for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: development and relief ngos provide services that cannot be provided by any other agency

for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: human rights and governance ngos in [country] work in the interests of opposition parties
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: in our country, people with disability should have equal rights and receive the same treatment as other people do
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: people practising same sex marriage or relationships have the right to do so, after all issues of sexual relationships are private
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: people who are persecuted for political reasons in their own countries deserve protection in [country]
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: political interference has made efforts of the police to arrest and prosecute party foot soldiers who indulge in criminal acts an impossible task
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: political party foot soldiers have no right to special treatment by governments in spite of their efforts to get their parties elected to govern
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: some activities of political party foot soldiers could threaten the peace and security of the country if left unchecked
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: some activities of political party foot soldiers that border on criminality must be prosecuted by the police
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: the courts have the right to make decisions that people always have to abide by
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: the demands of political party foot soldiers who toiled to get their parties elected are legitimate and should be satisfied by government
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: the fear of losing the partisan advantage gained from the presidential appointment of metropolitan or municipal or district chief executives (m or m or dces) is the reason governments have retained the arrangement
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: the police always have the right to make people obey the law
for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: the tax authorities always have the right to make people pay taxes
for each of the following, please indicate whether you think the act is wrong and must be discouraged, wrong but reasonable to politicians or not wrong at all: governments appoint party foot soldiers into public service without regard to their qualification and skills
for each of the following, please indicate whether you think the act is wrong and must be discouraged, wrong but reasonable to politicians or not wrong at all: governments award contracts for projects on the basis of party membership and not expertise for executing such jobs
for each of the following, please indicate whether you think the act is wrong and must be discouraged, wrong but reasonable to politicians or not wrong at all: governments make appointments on the basis of party membership and not qualification and competency

here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: attended a demostartion or protest march
here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: called in or joined social and political discussions on fm radio stations
here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: contacted a government department to raise an issue
here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: contacted radio, tv or a newspaper to complain about an issue
here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: gone on strike in order to demand a higher salary or better working conditions
here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: got together with others to raise an issue
here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: listened to social and political discussions on fm radio stations
here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: participated in community management of services such as school, health, or water or borehole committee
here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: refused to pay a tax or fee to government
here is a list of actions that people sometimes take as citizens. for each of these, please tell me whether you, personally, have done any of these things during the past year. if not, would you do this if you had the chance: refused to pay for services provided by government like water, electricity or property rates

in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of [country]? a citizen would have the right to get a [country]n passport and to vote in [country]ns elections if they are at least 18 years old: a person born in [country] with two non-[country]n parents
in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of [country]? a citizen would have the right to get a [country]n passport and to vote in [country]ns elections if they are at least 18 years old: a person who came from another country, but who has lived and worked in [country] for many years, and wishes to make [country] his or her home
in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of [country]? a citizen would have the right to get a [country]n passport and to vote in [country]ns elections if they are at least 18 years old: the husband of a [country]n woman, even if he was born outside of [country]
in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of [country]? a citizen would have the right to get a [country]n passport and to vote in [country]ns elections if they are at least 18 years old: the wife of a [country]n man, even if she was born outside of [country]
in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of benin? a citizen would have the right to get a beninese passport and to vote in beninese elections if they are at least 18 years old: a person born in benin with one beninese and one non-beninese parent
in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of benin? a citizen would have the right to get a beninese passport and to vote in beninese elections if they are at least 18 years old: a person born in benin with two non- beninese parents
in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of benin? a citizen would have the right to get a beninese passport and to vote in beninese elections if they are at least 18 years old: a person who came from another country, but who has lived and worked in benin for many years, and wishes to make benin his or her home
in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of benin? a citizen would have the right to get a beninese passport and to vote in beninese elections if they are at least 18 years old: a person who wishes to hold dual citizenship, that is, to be a citizen both of [[country]] and some other country

in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of botswana? a citizen would have the right to get a botswana passport and to vote in botswana elections if they are at least 18 years old:  a person who came from another country, but who has lived and worked in botswana for many years, and wishes to make botswana his or her home
in your opinion, which of the following people have a right to be a citizen of botswana? a citizen would have the right to get a botswana passport and to vote in botswana elections if they are at least 18 years old:  a person who wishes to hold dual citizenship, that is, to be a citizen both of botswana and some other country

let’s talk for a moment about the kind of society we would like to have in this country. which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: once in office, elected leaders are obliged to help their home community or group first. statement 2: since elected leaders should represent everyone, they should not do anything that favours their own group over others

now let us use a different scale. on a scale between 0 and 10, where 0 means very poor and 10 means very good, how do you rate the performance of your district administration in the following areas, or haven’t you heard enough to say: administering, managing, and regulating the use of land
now let us use a different scale. on a scale between 0 and 10, where 0 means very poor and 10 means very good, how do you rate the performance of your district administration in the following areas, or haven’t you heard enough to say: community development and welfare
now let us use a different scale. on a scale between 0 and 10, where 0 means very poor and 10 means very good, how do you rate the performance of your district administration in the following areas, or haven’t you heard enough to say: ensuring that there is good quality services in public health facilities
now let us use a different scale. on a scale between 0 and 10, where 0 means very poor and 10 means very good, how do you rate the performance of your district administration in the following areas, or haven’t you heard enough to say: improving the quality of education
now let us use a different scale. on a scale between 0 and 10, where 0 means very poor and 10 means very good, how do you rate the performance of your district administration in the following areas, or haven’t you heard enough to say: maintaining local market places
now let us use a different scale. on a scale between 0 and 10, where 0 means very poor and 10 means very good, how do you rate the performance of your district administration in the following areas, or haven’t you heard enough to say: maintaining local roads
now let us use a different scale. on a scale between 0 and 10, where 0 means very poor and 10 means very good, how do you rate the performance of your district administration in the following areas, or haven’t you heard enough to say: provision of agricultural extension services
now let us use a different scale. on a scale between 0 and 10, where 0 means very poor and 10 means very good, how do you rate the performance of your district administration in the following areas, or haven’t you heard enough to say: provision of safe water supply
now let’s speak about the present government of this country. how well or badly would you say the current government is handling the following matters, or haven’t you heard enough to say: empowering people with disabilities
now let’s speak about the present government of this country. how well or badly would you say the current government is handling the following matters, or haven’t you heard enough to say: ensuring availability of paraffin, petrol, and diesel
now let’s speak about the present government of this country. how well or badly would you say the current government is handling the following matters, or haven’t you heard enough to say: ensuring the availability of foreign exchange
now let’s speak about the present government of this country. how well or badly would you say the current government is handling the following matters, or haven’t you heard enough to say: improving the living standards of the poor
now let’s speak about the present government of this country. how well or badly would you say the current government is handling the following matters, or haven’t you heard enough to say: managing the economy
now let’s talk about the management of revenue from the country’s recent oil find.  please tell me whether you agree or disagree with the following statements: as a country, we should not use our future oil revenues as guarantee for current borrowing (i.e. collateralization)
now let’s talk about the management of revenue from the country’s recent oil find.  please tell me whether you agree or disagree with the following statements: government must distribute some of the oil revenues equally to all citizens in the form of cash transfers
now let’s talk about the management of revenue from the country’s recent oil find.  please tell me whether you agree or disagree with the following statements: government should not give the country’s oil revenue to public enterprises or private sector entities as loans
now let’s talk about the management of revenue from the country’s recent oil find.  please tell me whether you agree or disagree with the following statements: the country should save part of its oil revenue in a special account for future generations
now let’s talk about the management of revenue from the country’s recent oil find.  please tell me whether you agree or disagree with the following statements: the country should use only some percentage of the oil revenue to be determined by parliament to finance annual budget
numéro du répondant
on a scale between 0 and 10, where 0 means completely undemocratic and 10 means completely democratic, where would you place each of the following, or haven’t you heard enough to say: algeria under french colonial rule

we are now going to discuss how you rate different forms of government i would like you to give marks out of 10. the best form of governing a country gets 10 out of 10 and the worst form of governing a country gets no marks at all. what grade would you give to: our current system of government with regular elections where everyone can vote and there are at least two political parties
we are now going to discuss how you rate different forms of government i would like you to give marks out of 10. the best form of governing a country gets 10 out of 10 and the worst form of governing a country gets no marks at all. what grade would you give to: the political system of this country as you expect it to be in 10 years time
we are now going to discuss how you rate different forms of government i would like you to give marks out of 10. the best form of governing a country gets 10 out of 10 and the worst form of governing a country gets no marks at all. what grade would you give to: the way the country was governed under apartheid
we have spoken to many swazis and they have all described themselves in different ways.  some people describe themselves in terms of their language, ethnic group, race, religion, or gender and others describe themselves in economic terms, such as working class, middle class, or a farmer. besides being swazi, which specific group do you feel you belong to first and foremost

were you physically threatened during the interview

which of the challenges listed below do you think is the most important constraint facing the economic and financial crimes commission in their fight against corruption
which of the challenges listed below do you think is the most important constraint facing the independent corrupt practices commission in their fight against corruption
which of the following describes your relationship with the political party you feel close to:
which of the following do you think should participate in naming members to the national electoral commission: all political parties that have seats in the assembly of the republic
which of the following do you think should participate in naming members to the national electoral commission: all political parties, even those that don’t have seats in the assembly of the republic
which of the following do you think should participate in naming members to the national electoral commission: civil society organizations
which of the following do you think should participate in naming members to the national electoral commission: the president
which of the following do you think should participate in naming members to the national electoral commission: the ruling party
which of the following statements is closest to your view?  choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: public officials have a right to privacy and should not be required to disclose their personal assets.  statement 2: to aid the fight against corruption, public officials should be required to disclose their personal assets
which of the following statements is closest to your view?  choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the ruling party was elected by a majority of mozambicans, it has a right to use government resources and facilities to conduct the party’s business.    statement 2: government resources should only be used for government business.  no political party should be allowed to use government resources or facilities for its business
which of the following statements is closest to your view?  choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the central office for combating corruption performs its duties and functions as a neutral body, guided only by the law.      statement 2:the central office for combating corruption makes decisions that favour particular people or political parties
which of the following statements is closest to your view?  choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the current system, where the prime minister explains the government’s policies to the assembly of the republic, works well and should be retained.   statement 2: the law should be changed so that it is the president who explains government policies to the assembly of the republic, rather than the prime minister
which of the following statements is closest to your view?  choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the national electoral commission performs its duties as a neutral body guided only by law.     statement 2: the national electoral commission makes decisions that favor particular people, parties or interests
which of the following statements is closest to your view?  choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the prosecutor’s office performs its duties and functions as a neutral body, guided only by the law.      statement 2:the prosecutor’s office makes decisions that favour particular people or political parties.             46
which of the following statements is closest to your view?  choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the work of members of the assembly of the republic requires their full time attention.  they should not be allowed to hold any other public position.  statement 2: members of the assembly of the republic should be allowed to hold other public positions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2         20 statement 1: the news media should constantly investigate and report on government mistakes and corruption. statement 2: too much reporting on negative events, like government mistakes and corruption, only harms the country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2         21 statement 1: the news media should constantly investigate and report on government mistakes and corruption. statement 2: too much reporting on negative events, like government mistakes and corruption, only harms the country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 **statement 1: parliament should ensure that the president explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers’ money. **statement 2: the president should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 **statement 1: the constitution should limit the president to serving a maximum of two terms in office. **statement 2: there should be no constitutional limit on how long the president can serve
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: opposition parties should regularly examine and criticize government policies and actions. statement 2: opposition parties should concentrate on cooperating with government and helping it develop the country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: opposition parties should regularly examine and criticize government policies and actions. statement 2: opposition parties should concentrate on cooperating with government and helping it develop the country.         20
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: parliament should ensure that the president explains to it on a regular basis how her government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the president should be able to devote her full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: parliament should ensure that the president explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the president should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: parliament should ensure that the prime minister explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the prime minister should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: the assembly of the republic should ensure that the president explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the president should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: the constitution should limit the president to serving a maximum of two terms in office. statement 2: there should be no constitutional limit on how long the president can serve
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: the constitution should limit the prime minister to serving a maximum of two terms in office. statement 2: there should be no constitutional limit on how long the prime minister can serve
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: the house of representatives should ensure that the president explains to it on a regular basis how her government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the president should be able to devote her full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying her actions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: the national assembly should ensure that the president explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the president should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: the national assembly should ensure that the prime minister explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the prime minister should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: the national constituent council should ensure that the prime minister explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the prime minister should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: the news media should constantly investigate and report on government mistakes and corruption. statement 2: too much reporting on negative events, like government mistakes and corruption, only harms the country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2:  statement 1: the constitution of the republic of botswana has served this country well and should be left unchanged. statement 2: the existing constitution of the republic of botswana is inadequate to deal with contemporary issues of governance and democracy and should therefore be revised
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.             15 statement 1: men make better political leaders than women, and should be elected rather than women. statement 2: women should have the same chance of being elected to political office as men
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.             23 **statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  **statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.          21 statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.          22 statement 1: members of parliament represent the people; therefore they should make laws for this country, even if the president does not agree. statement 2: since the president represents all of us, he should pass laws without worrying about what parliament thinks
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: if funds for schooling are limited, a boy should always receive an education in school before a girl. statement 2: if funds for schooling are limited, a family should send the child with the greatest ability to learn
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: in our country, women should have equal rights and receive the same treatment as men do. statement 2: women have always been subject to traditional laws and customs, and should remain so
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: local [country]an civic organizations and non-government organizations (ngos) are doing a lot to help the people of this country. statement 2: local [country]an civic organizations and non-government organizations (ngos) only advance the individual interests of their leaders; they do not do much to help the people of this country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: members of parliament that wish to leave their parties and join new ones should be allowed to do so without going through a by-election. statement 2: members of parliament who decide to leave their parties and join new ones should be required to seek a fresh electoral mandate from their constituents in a by-election
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: men make better political leaders than women, and should be elected rather than women.         15 statement 2: women should have the same chance of being elected to political office as men
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: men make better political leaders than women, and should be elected rather than women. statement 2: women should have the same chance of being elected to political office as men
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: men make better political leaders than women, and should be elected rather than women. statement 2: women should have the same chance of being elected to political office as men.         15
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: paying additional taxes will place so much economic burden on citizens. government should bear the cost for free healthcare policy, be it universal or targeted at women and children. statement 2: i will prefer to pay additional taxes to benefit from free universal healthcare from any public hospital or clinic rather than the women and children targeted free healthcare policy
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: political parties should voluntarily institute a quota system for women to encourage more women to seek leadership positions.  statement 2: sierra leone as a country should pass a law that automatically grants women some quota for leadership positions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: the [country] electoral commission performs its duties as a neutral body guided only by law.  statement 2: the [country] electoral commission makes decisions that favour particular people, parties or interests
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: the anti corruption bureau performs its duties as a neutral body as guided only by the law.  statement 2: the anti corruption bureau makes decisions that favour particular people or political parties
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: the armed forces liberated [country] from colonialism; they must therefore continue to be actively involved in the country’s politics. statement 2: the armed forces are for the external defence and security of [country]; they must not be involved at all in the country’s politics
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: the government is like a parent. it should decide which is good for us. statement 2: the government is like our employee. we are the bosses and should tell government what to do
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: the media should have the right to publish any views and ideas without government control. statement 2: the government should have the right to prevent the media from publishing things that it consider harmful to society
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: the quota system of selection of students to public colleges and universities is necessary to ensure fair access to tertiary education for all districts of the country  statement 2: the quota system of selection of students to public colleges and universities is discriminatory and it does not promote fair competition among all students
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: those who are responsible for past political crimes should be granted amnesty, which means that they would never be prosecuted. statement 2: those who are responsible for past political crimes should be held accountable; they should face consequences for what they have done
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.     statement 1: to get more women involved in governance matters in sierra leone, more women must eagerly compete just like men for political positions.  statement 2: sierra leone will not get more women involved in governance matters unless a quota system for women in adopted
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   **statement 1: political parties create division and confusion; it is therefore unnecessary to have many political parties in the country. **statement 2: many political parties are needed to make sure that [[country]ians] have real choices in who governs them
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1 the composition of the government of national unity (gnu) in zanzibar should be extended to all political parties that took part in the 2010 elections regardless of the number of seats won. statement 2:the composition of the government of national unity (gnu) should only be confined to the two parties that won the most seats in the 2010zanzibar elections
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1:  in electing a member of parliament, i prefer to vote for a candidate who can deliver goods and services to people in my constituency. statement 2:  in electing a member of parliament, i prefer to vote for a candidate who can make policies that benefit everyone in our country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1:  in order to guarantee the separation of powers between the executive and the legislature, cabinet ministers should only be appointed from outside parliament  statement 2: the current practice of appointing cabinet ministers from parliament does not undermine the principle of separation of powers between the executive and legislature and should be continued
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1:  the recently formed government of national unity (gnu) is undermining democracy in zanzibar by eliminating the official opposition in the council of representatives statement 2: the government of national unity (gnu), which has brought successful opposition parties into government,  is a demostartion of mature and effective democracy in zanzibar
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: community councils and chiefs have different roles in the community; they should work independently of one another.  statement 2: community councils and chiefs will provide greatest benefit to their communities if they learn to work together
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: constitutional review should involve a complete rewrite of the constitution. statement 2: constitutional review should only address a few contentious portions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: illegal migration of [nationality] to [country] has negative consequences for lesotho, and the government should take more steps to prevent it.  statement 2: there are not enough jobs in lesotho, so illegal migration of [nationality] to [country] is necessary for economic survival; the government should therefore focus on other problems
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: political parties create division and confusion; it is therefore unnecessary to have many political parties in [country] statement 2: many political parties are needed to make sure that [country]ns have real choices in who governs them

which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: public officials under investigation for corruption undermine the integrity and credibility of government and should be required to resign their positions during the investigations. statement 2: public officials under investigation for corruption remain innocent until proven guilty by a court of law; they should therefore remain in office unless convicted
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: since members of parliament are elected on a political party ticket, they should always act in accordance with the wishes of their parties. statement 2: although members of parliament are elected on a party platform, they should always act in accordance with the wishes of the people who elected them
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: the constitution of the united republic of [country] has served the country well and should be left unchanged. statement 2: the existing constitution of the united republic of [country] is rife with indequacies and should be revised
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: the directorate for corruption and economic offences performs its duties as a neutral body guided only by the law.  statement 2: the directorate for corruption and economic offences makes decisions that favour particular people, parties or interests
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: the government should maintain a fuel subsidy to keep fuel prices low and improve living standards. statement 2: the fuel subsidy is too expensive, the government should remove it

which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1 cabinet ministers should be required to declare their assets and liabilities to an independent body instead of the current system of declaring to the president statement 2: the current system where cabinet ministers declare their assets and liabilities to the president is sufficient and should therefore be left unchanged
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1 the current system where parliament chooses the president should be changed to allow for direct election of the president. statement 2: the current system where the president of the country is chosen by parliament has served botswana well and should be retained
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1 the law on declaration of assets and liabilities by cabinet ministers should be expanded to include members of parliament and senior government officials. statement 2: the current law which requires only cabinet ministers to declare their assets and liabilities is sufficient
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: a councilor who resigns from his or her party to join another party or stay independent, must vacate his or her seat so that fresh elections can be held in their area. statement 2: a councilor should be allowed to resign from his or her party and join a party of his or her own choice without having to vacate his or her seat
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: a member of parliament who resigns from his or her party to join another party or stay independent, must vacate his or her seat so that fresh elections can be held in their area. statement 2: a member of parliament should be allowed to resign from his or her party and join a party of his or her own choice without having to vacate his or her seat

which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: citizens must pay their taxes to the government in order for our country to develop.  statement 2: the government can find enough resources for development from other sources without having to tax the people
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: government should improve the quality of the public health system, although this will require that some people have to pay more taxes. statement 2: people cannot afford to pay more taxes; we should keep the present public health system
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: it is better to have free schooling for our children, even if the quality of education is low. statement 2: it is better to raise educational standards, even if we have to pay school fees
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: it is better to pay higher taxes, if it means that there will be more services provided by government  statement 2: it is better to pay lower taxes, even if it means there will be fewer services provided by government
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: it is important to obey the government in power, no matter who you voted for.  statement 2: it is not necessary to obey the laws of a government that you did not vote for
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: it is more important to have a government that can get things done, even if we have no influence over what it does. statement 2: it is more important for citizens to be able to hold government accountable, even if that means it makes decisions more slowly
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: local swazi civic organizations and non-government organizations or ngos are doing a lot to help the people of this country. statement 2: the local swazi civic organizations and non-government organizations or ngos only advance the interests of their leaders; they do not do much to help the people of this country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: members of parliament represent the people; therefore they should make laws for this country, even if the king does not agree. statement 2: since the king represents all of us, he should pass laws without worrying about what parliament thinks
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: members of parliament represent the people; therefore they should make laws for this country, even if the president does not agree. statement 2: since the president represents all of us, he should pass laws without worrying about what parliament thinks
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: members of parliament represent the people; therefore they should make laws for this country, even if the prime minister does not agree. statement 2: since the prime minister represents all of us, he should pass laws without worrying about what parliament thinks
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: members of the assembly of the republic represent the people; therefore they should make laws for this country, even if the president does not agree. statement 2: since the president represents all of us, he should pass laws without worrying about what the assembly of the republic thinks
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: members of the house of representatives represent the people; therefore they should make laws for this country, even if the president does not agree. statement 2: since the president represents all of us, she should pass laws without worrying about what parliament thinks
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: members of the national assembly represent the people; therefore they should make laws for this country, even if the president does not agree. statement 2: since the president represents all of us, he should pass laws without worrying about what the national assembly thinks
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: members of the national assembly represent the people; therefore they should make laws for this country, even if the president does not agree. statement 2: since the president represents all of us, he should pass laws without worrying about what the national assembly thinks.         21
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: members of the national constituent council represent the people; therefore they should make laws for this country, even if the prime minister does not agree. statement 2: since the prime represents all of us, he should pass laws without worrying about what the national constituent council thinks
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, she should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if she thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, she should not be bound by laws or court decisions that she thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if she thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the prime minister was appointed to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the prime minister must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the prime minister was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the prime minister must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the anti corruption commission mostly targets petty offenders while avoiding suspects who are politically important and well-connected.   statement 2: the anti corruption commission targets all levels of corruption without favoring any particular group
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the anti corruption commission mostly targets petty offenders while avoiding suspects who are politically important and well-connected. statement 2: the anti corruption commission targets all levels of corruption without favoring any particular group
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the anti corruption commission performs its duties as a neutral body as guided only by the law.  statement 2: the anti corruption commission makes decisions that favour particular people or political parties
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the anti corruption commission performs its duties as a neutral body guided only by the law. statement 2: the anti corruption commission makes decisions that favour particular people, group or interests
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the constitution of the kingdom of swaziland has served this country well and should be left unchanged. statement 2: the existing constitution of the kingdom of swaziland is inadequate to deal with contemporary issues of governance and democracy and should therefore be revised
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the government should be able to restrict access to any information it sees fit, even if this allows it to cover up mistakes and corruption. statement 2: the government should only be able to restrict access to information that is vital to national security, even if this means it is embarrassed from time to time
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the government should spend more resources to develop rural areas to help the rural poor and slow urban migration. statement 2: the government should spend more resources on urban housing to help the urban poor
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the government’s economic policies have helped most people; only a few have suffered.  statement 2: the government’s economic policies have hurt most people and only benefitted a few
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the independent electoral commission of [country] performs its duties as a neutral body guided only by law. statement 2: the independent electoral commission of [country] makes decisions that favour particular people, parties or interests
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the swazi constitution should be amended to allow for the existence of political parties in our country. statement 2: the constitutional ban on political parties has served the country well and should therefore be maintained

which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the use of violence is never justified in swaziland politics today. statement 2: in this country, it is sometimes necessary to use violence in support of a just cause
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the use of violence is never justified in tunisian politics today. statement 2: in this country, it is sometimes necessary to use violence in support of a just cause
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: we should choose our leaders in this country through regular, open and honest elections. statement 2: since elections sometimes produce bad results, we should adopt other methods for choosing this country’s leaders
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: creation of more local government areas will improve development of local communities. statement 2: creation of more local government areas will have no impact in the development of local communities
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: creation of more states will improve the development of [country]. statement 2: creation of more states will have no impact in the development of [country]
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: if funds for schooling are limited, a boy should always receive an education in school before a girl. statement 2: if funds for schooling are limited, a family should send the child with the greatest ability to learn
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: in our country, women should have equal rights and receive the same treatment as men do. statement 2: women have always been subject to traditional laws and customs, and should remain so
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: it is important to obey the government in power, no matter who you voted for. statement 2: it is not necessary to obey the laws of a government that you did not vote for
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: it is more important to have a government that can get things done, even if we have no influence over what it does. statement 2: it is more important for citizens to be able to hold government accountable, even if that means it makes decisions more slowly
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: men make better political leaders than women, and should be elected rather than women. statement 2: women should have the same chance of being elected to political office as men
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: political party foot soldiers in [country] toil for their parties because they believe in their programs.. statement 2: political party foot soldiers in [country] toil for their parties because they expect material rewards after winning political power
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong. statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: socio-cultural organizations make a positive contribution to the development of mauritian society. statement 2:socio-cultural organizations are divisive and can cause conflicts. they do not help the development of mauritian society
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the [country]n presidency should rotate among different zones of the country. statement 2: anyone should be able to contest for the [country]n presidency without regard to region
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the current system of public vetting for individuals seeking senior positions in government is necessary to ensure that government workers have the proper qualifications. statement 2: the current system of public vetting is too invasive and may be keeping qualified individuals from seeking government jobs
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the fm radio stations should have the right to discuss any topic without government regulation. statement 2: the government should have the right to regulate fm radio stations to prevent them from discussing things that it considers harmful to family values
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the government is like a parent. it should decide which is good for us. statement 2: the government is like our employee. we are the bosses and should tell government what to do
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the media should have the right to publish any views and ideas without government control. statement 2: the government should have the right to prevent the media from publishing things that it consider harmful to society
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the metropolitan, municipal and district chief executives (m or m or dces) should be elected by citizens in the local authority area. statement 2: the metropolitan, municipal and district chief executives (m or m or dces) should continue to be appointed by the president with the approval of assembly members
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the percentage of oil revenue to be used to support the annual budget should be spent dedicated to financing education, water, sanitation, electricity, and healthcare. statement 2: the percentage of oil revenue for supporting the annual budget should be used to finance current consumption items such as food and other consumable imports
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the use of violence is never justified in egyptian politics today. statement 2: in this country, it is sometimes necessary to use violence in support of a just cause
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: we should choose our leaders in this country through regular, open and honest elections. statement 2: since elections sometimes produce bad results, we should adopt other methods for choosing this country’s leaders
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. the government should create a fund dedicated to the development of the region where the country’s oil resource is located. statement 2: pursuing development on the basis of natural resource endowments of regions could widen the development gap among regions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1or statement 2.     statement 1: government should be able to ban any organization that goes against its policies.         15 statement 2: we should be able to join any organization, whether or not the government approves of it
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1or statement 2.     statement 1: government should be able to ban any organization that goes against its policies. statement 2: we should be able to join any organization, whether or not the government approves of it
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1or statement 2. statement 1: government should be able to ban any organization that goes against its policies. statement 2: we should be able to join any organization, whether or not the government approves of it
which of these statements is closest to your own opinion?     statement 1: in order for the country to move forward, those who committed crimes against humanity should not be required to confess their roles before they can stand for elected office. statement 2: since reconciliation is about speaking the truth, individuals who committed crimes against humanity should not be allowed to stand for elected office unless they publicly confess to their wrong doing during the conflicts in liberia
which of these statements is closest to your own opinion?    .     statement 1: the unmil has served its purpose of bringing peace and training the country’s police and army and can now depart and turn security over to the armed forces of liberia (afl) and the liberia national police (lnp). statement 2: the police and the armed forces of liberia (afl) require additional training to assume the huge responsibility of maintaining national security so unmil should remain until after the 2017 elections
